items.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma
items.summary: Today, we’re introducing the ability to embed Figma Make prototypes into Figma Design, FigJam, and Figma Slides, along with new editing tools that help you build and share your best ideas.

items.title: The new business case for design systems
items.summary: Design systems have evolved from static libraries to key drivers of business revenue, customer loyalty, and product strategy. Here’s what you need to know about how to track and communicate the value of your design system, based on new research from the Design Executive Council (DXC).

items.title: Software is culture
items.summary: The software we scroll, tap, pinch, and swipe has irrevocably shaped the way we think and feel. As that software grows more intelligent, we look back on the most influential interactions from the past 20 years to see where we may be headed next.

items.title: Issue no.14: Software is culture
items.summary: From ordering delivery in a pinch, to finding genuine connection and meaning, software touches nearly every part of our lives.

items.title: Cooking with constraints: A designer’s framework for better AI prompts

items.title: Press start: How controllers shaped video game design—and where interfaces may go next

items.title: Chat, are we cooked? How language has become the new metric of virality
items.summary: We sat down with linguist Adam Aleksic, author of “Algospeak: How Social Media Is Transforming the Future of Language,” to learn how algorithms shape not just how we talk, but how we think and relate.

items.title: Prototypes are the new PRDs
items.summary: A growing number of product managers are finding that the fastest way to clarity is to build. Inside Figma Make, they’re pressure-testing assumptions early, building momentum, and rallying teams around something tangible.

items.title: Hard problems are still hard: A story about the tools that change and the work that doesn't
items.summary: Figma designer–turned–product manager Nikolas Klein worked on building prototyping tools for seven years. Then AI changed the game.

items.title: What our quantum computing milestone means
items.summary: This moment represents a distinct milestone in our effort to harness the principles of quantum mechanics to solve computational problems.

items.title: How to make AI that’s good for people
items.summary: If we want AI to play a positive role in tomorrow’s world, it must be guided by human concerns.

items.title: How Totogi automated change request processing with Totogi BSS Magic and Amazon Bedrock
items.summary: This blog post describes how Totogi automates change request processing by partnering with the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center and using the rapid innovation capabilities of Amazon Bedrock.

items.title: Build AI agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore using AWS CloudFormation
items.summary: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore services are now being supported by various IaC frameworks such as AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK), Terraform and AWS CloudFormation Templates. This integration brings the power of IaC directly to AgentCore so developers can provision, configure, and manage their AI agent infrastructure. In this post, we use CloudFormation templates to build an end-to-end application for a weather activity planner.

items.title: How the Amazon.com Catalog Team built self-learning generative AI at scale with Amazon Bedrock
items.summary: In this post, we demonstrate how the Amazon Catalog Team built a self-learning system that continuously improves accuracy while reducing costs at scale using Amazon Bedrock.

items.title: How PDI built an enterprise-grade RAG system for AI applications with AWS
items.summary: PDI Technologies is a global leader in the convenience retail and petroleum wholesale industries. In this post, we walk through the PDI Intelligence Query (PDIQ) process flow and architecture, focusing on the implementation details and the business outcomes it has helped PDI achieve.

items.title: How CLICKFORCE accelerates data-driven advertising with Amazon Bedrock Agents
items.summary: In this post, we demonstrate how CLICKFORCE used AWS services to build Lumos and transform advertising industry analysis from weeks-long manual work into an automated, one-hour process.

items.title: How Thomson Reuters built an Agentic Platform Engineering Hub with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
items.summary: This blog post explains how TR’s Platform Engineering team, a geographically distributed unit overseeing TR’s service availability, boosted its operational productivity by transitioning from manual to an automated agentic system using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore.

items.title: Build agents to learn from experiences using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore episodic memory
items.summary: In this post, we walk you through the complete architecture to structure and store episodes, discuss the reflection module, and share compelling benchmarks that demonstrate significant improvements in agent task success rates.

items.title: How bunq handles 97% of support with Amazon Bedrock
items.summary: In this post, we show how bunq upgraded Finn, its in-house generative AI assistant, using Amazon Bedrock to transform user support and banking operations to be seamless, in multiple languages and time zones.

items.title: Using Strands Agents to create a multi-agent solution with Meta’s Llama 4 and Amazon Bedrock
items.summary: In this post, we explore how to build a multi-agent video processing workflow using Strands Agents, Meta’s Llama 4 models, and Amazon Bedrock to automatically analyze and understand video content through specialized AI agents working in coordination. To showcase the solution, we will use Amazon SageMaker AI to walk you through the code.

items.title: Introducing multimodal retrieval for Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases
items.summary: In this post, we’ll guide you through building multimodal RAG applications. You’ll learn how multimodal knowledge bases work, how to choose the right processing strategy based on your content type, and how to configure and implement multimodal retrieval using both the console and code examples.
